title: Ps4 Controllers for LoL
body:
Well my friends and i were discussing how cool it would be to add in that you can play League with a Ps4 Controller. Via the USB cord they use to charge. We came up with the Key binds and here they are.
X, ◻️, ▲, ⚪ - Will be your Abilities E.g. Q,W,E,R.
L1, R1 - Will be your Summoner Spells E.g. D, F.
L2 - Will be Cancel auto attack.
R2- Start Auto attacking.
Touchpad - Quick open shop.
L Analog Stick - Move around ( when someone is highlighted click R2 to AA)
R Analog Stick - Mouse and camera lock, move around as mouse, push in and it locks camera.
D-pad - to operate Shop.
Options - Pause.
Share - Save Replays.
At End Of Game to Honor you use D-Pad.

If you agree with this lets get it know to all the staff and get them to read if you believe i have missed something please tell me thank you and i look for to your responses.

replies.body: First off, I have been playing LoL without a keyboard for over a year now, just my Razer Tartarus, and I have found that that barely has enough keys to keep me happy. I have no idea how you could even imagine playing with less than the 17 keys + 8 way thumbpad that I use. The only reason I even use it is because it prevents my RSI from getting too severe. Seriously, there just aren't enough buttons on a console controller to be functional. And that's not even beginning to count the fact that you need to move a cursor around on the screen. I'm sorry to say it, but analog sticks are far inferior to mice when it comes to anything that isn't an fps or fifa.
you should use your L3 to ctrl to level up your abilities
You cannot possibly get the flexibility from using an analog stick over a mouse. There's a reason nobody does this except as a joke.

You can use PlayStation (and XBox) controllers anyway (BoxBox does this during special streams - i.e. Christmas, Valentine's, etc.). One guy on YouTube even used a xylophone to play Bard. 

Just Google how to do it. If you can't, search up Rossboomsocks (the xylophone Bard guy). He made a video about how he managed to hook up the xylophone and controllers (for his other videos). 

XBox controllers can be automatically be used in PC games (provided you have MS Windows), whereas PlayStation controllers require downloadable software. You can find adaption cables for any PlayStation controller (i.e. PS2) as well. 

Hope this helps :)
